area_name: Bavarian Wall and The Far Side

content.description: This is a fun little warmup just left of Snake Ladder. Climb up to a large flake then move up and right (crux) before stepping back left and continuing to a lower-off.
content.protection: 6 or so bolts to a lower-off.
content.location: Easily identified by the obvious flake about 20' off the ground.

content.description: Finger crack in a short right facing corner (gear and bolt) leads to a sloping ledge. Clip a another bolt and launch into the boulder problem crux. Head up and right to steep crack moves, another bolt and bomber gear to lower off anchor.
content.location: This is the next route left from Pigs in Mud.

content.description: Fun big moves low to balancey traversey fare towards the top
content.location: Right side of the Bavarian Wall

content.description: Great hands to finger crack through a roof.
content.protection: Single set to #3 Camalot, nuts. Use the anchor up and left.

content.description: The 2nd from left most route at the Far Side. Climb steep rock through interspersed bolts and gear placements. Beautiful orange granite.

climbs.name: My Way or the Ha Way
climbs.fa: Ha Ngo, Trevor Hobbs, Tom Helvie

content.description: Climb to the 3rd bolt of Chubby Hubby, then move up and left following the thin left arching cracks (small cam) to join Chunky Monkey's upper half.  Avoids the cruxes of both routes to create a moderate link up.
content.protection: quickdraws, small TCUs/aliens, lower off anchor.  A wee bit sporty.

content.description:
This is a short 5.9 trad route on the far right (east) end of the Far Side crag and is a nice little trad warmup that allows you to toprope "Buddha Boy" (5.10c pg13) after leading this one to the anchors, or vice versa of course.  It's a worthwhile climb, and is actually quite enjoyable.

Start the climb by surmounting a ledge a few feet above head height that puts you in a corner beneath a bulge.  Jam and stem through the bulge (fun moves), then jam the rest of the way to the anchor.
content.protection: Light rack. Single set of cams from BD .5 to #3 (or equivalent) should do the trick. Nuts might be useful to some. Two Mussy hooks at the bolted anchors.
content.location: Look for a set of anchors that are the farthest to the right (east) of the north side of Pratt's Crack Canyon.  They are located near the top of the crag, between two parallel cracks, and to the left of a fairly sizable bush/tree.  See photo for topo.

climbs.name: Dave's Route
climbs.fa: Dave Tidwell, Chris Van Leuven, In a Snow Storm

content.description: A hard mixed line to the left of Chunky Monkey, passing 2 bolts and some good gear placements before joining Chunky Monkey and continuing to the anchor.
content.protection: Originally a mixed line, this route was recently updated (2019) and is now fully bolted.
content.location: First route on the left on the Bavarian wall

content.description: Climb past 2 bolts to gain a interesting crack on good rock.
content.protection: 2 bolts, single set to #3 camalot. Lower.

content.description: Sprint through the edges on the steep golden shield and then relax as the terrain mellows up to the anchor. Second pitch is still an unequipped project.
content.location: Right of Dave’s Route and Left of Chubby Hubby

content.description:
Start 20' left of the Bavarian Tower, up a steep wall to a clean right facing corner. Fire this crux and you can lower off the the two ring anchor on the ledge at 40 feet. Better yet, clip the anchor with a runner and continue up the unique left facing corner to a wild arete and anchor at 35 meter. The hangers for this route and extension are Fixe, painted Grey.  Clip 1 unpainted bolt from the Bavarian Tower (which climbs right) after the first set on anchors(runner also advised)

12a to first anchor. 10d to second anchor. Linking Recommended
content.protection: 16 draws and 2 runners, including  anchor. 70 meter rope, knot the end.

climbs.name: Five Easy Pieces
climbs.fa: Tai Devore, Kelly Cordner, John Barbella

content.description: Blocky start leads to face and left side of wide crack dihedral. Cruxes passing bolts 3 and 6. Quartz chicken heads above bolt 8.
content.protection: 15 tan hangers, senior bolting, hook anchors.

climbs.name: Buddha Boy
climbs.fa: Dave Lane and Jen Lane, Oct. 2014 GU

content.description:
This one involves thin crack and face climbing.  Short but fun and challenging.  The rock does feel a bit loose in many spots, so be conscious of how you pull on these holds.

Face climb to a ledge, pull the roof/bulge, then jam to the anchors.

Can be toproped after leading "Hanabata" to its left.
content.protection: Light rack.  Single rack BD #0.3 to 2 and nuts.  Mussy hooks at the two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is the farthest route to the right (east) side of the Far Side crag and to the entire north side of the Pratt's Crack Canyon as well.  See photos for more reference.

content.description: An under appreciated classic. A great adventure over four varied pitches of crack and face climbing.
content.protection: 1-2 set of cams. At least 1, but maybe you'd like 2, #4's for the final pitch. 2 ropes to get down.
content.location: Starts up a crack protected with 4 gold bolts. This crack was originally filled with loose rock and debris but has cleaned up surprisingly well. Trend right at the start of the second pitch, avoiding the grey painted hangers on Chubby Hubby.

pathTokens: Bavarian Wall and The Far Side
